content.question: Two isolated, positively charged spheres are held together with an insulating string of negligible mass so that the centers of the spheres are a distance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> apart. Sphere 1 has charge <math alttext="Q sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and mass <math alttext="M sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . Sphere 2 has charge <math alttext="2 Q sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mn>2</mn><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and mass <math alttext="2 M sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . The two-sphere system has internal energy <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> . What is the internal energy of the system after the string is cut and the spheres have moved far away from each other?

choices.label: It cannot be determined unless an exact new distance between the spheres is given.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
